snippet: Across Central America, a kidney disease has killed at least 20,000 people over a decade and is so poorly understood that it does not have a universally agreed upon name.
abstract: Disease that affects kidneys has killed at least 20,000 people in Central America over past decade, particularly affecting Nicaragua's sugar cane workers; illness is so poorly understood that it still does not have universally agreed upon name.
lead_paragraph: Across Central America, a kidney disease has killed at least 20,000 people over a decade and is so poorly understood that it does not have a universally agreed upon name.

headline.main: Deadly Illness in Nicaragua Baffles Experts
headline.print_headline: Nicaragua Sugar Workers Fall to Illness That Baffles Experts

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
